mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Encloses mortgage of the purchaser of Short's land; comments that the duration of the war is uncertain; it is leading to the increase of domestic manufacturing, which is beneficial to Americans; speculates that Britain's aim is permanent conquest of the ocean, which requires countermeasures, including the taking of Canada, but he will "leave to the vigour of younger minds" strategy.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1813 June 18, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William Short], n.p.
